item.title: Vectorize ROC Curve for Bayesian Models
item.description: In this notebook, we present a simple example to illustrate how to vectorize the ROC curve computation over a Bayesian model. This is helpful when we want to compute the ROC curve using the implementations from scikit-learn. We use the classical moons dataset to generate the data and fit a Gaussian process models similarly as the previous post Scikit-Learn Example in PyMC: Gaussian Process Classifier. Prepare Notebook import arviz as az import matplotlib.

item.title: How to vectorize an scikit-learn transformer over a numpy array?
item.description: In this short post, I show how to vectorize an scikit-learn transformer over a numpy array. That is, how to apply a transformer along a specific axes of a numpy array. I have found this to be particularly useful when working with output sample posterior distributions from a bayesian model where I want to apply a transformer to each sample. This is not particularly difficult, but I always forget how to do it, so I thought I would write it down once and for all ðŸ˜„.
